intro: Choristega alveolata, commonly known as the alveolate orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its intricate, delicate flowers that feature a distinctive alveolate pattern on the petals and sepals. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or high-altitude areas. Its botanical structure includes a slender, erect stem with few leaves and a single, showy inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
